issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The initial set of admin credentials includes http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Empyrean and http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Properties alongside its access keys, but it can't do that for the IAM service since CLCs do not always host that any more.  This means that creating the first regular account involves manually supplying euca2ools with the IAM service's location.  However, if accessing http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Euare on a CLC that doesn't host that service resulted in a redirect to a machine that does then that would no longer be the case, simplifying installation somewhat.
fields.summary: Connecting to IAM on a CLC that doesn't host it should redirect to an IAM endpoint

comments.body:
I would think this works already, did you give it a try?

{code}

# export export AWS_IAM_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Euare
#
#
# euare-accountlist

(eucalyptus)database	000439179496
(eucalyptus)loadbalancing	000877495251
(eucalyptus)blockstorage	000741267931
(eucalyptus)objectstorage	000442982631
eucalyptus	000974788036
(eucalyptus)imaging	000244780891
test-account-0	000045233437
(eucalyptus)aws-exec-read	000625794825
test	000368078706

I honestly don't know what I was thinking when I filed this bug; it doesn't accurately describe my problem at all.  Closing...
